item.title: American Music Festival to be Held June 7-8
item.description: Presented by Albany Symphony Orchestra and scheduled to be held throughout Troy June 7-8, this festival will feature composer workshops and rehearsal readings, post-concert musical mingling at Evelyn’s Cafe, recitals, Dogs of Desire on Friday, the culminating Festival concert on Saturday, and more.

item.title: How Should Brands Respond to Positive Online Reviews?
item.description: While businesses are widely encouraged to respond to negative online reviews, a new study finds responding to positive online reviews is more of a “minefield,” and some should be ignored. Researchers at Rensselaer and Baruch College’s Zicklin School of Business analyzed ten years of online reviews of hotels from Trip Advisor, and found the type of response widely depends on the critique.

item.title: Quantum Computing Users Group Organizational Meeting
item.description: The Future of Computing Institute announces the formation of a Quantum Computing Users Group. On Wednesday, June 12th, from noon to 2 pm, there will be an organizational meeting in CII 3116. The goals are to find out about the experience and background of interested parties, evaluate what more is needed to enable the campus QC to be used effectively and efficiently and discuss other subjects that the group may find interesting. RSVP: Tom Morgan, morgat5@rpi.edu

item.description: Date: Friday, June 7, 2024 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM - The Off-Campus Commons is pleased to host this virtual housing fair to give students a chance to learn more about off-campus housing, meet the RPI staff who can assist, and interact with several property owners who cater to RPI students. item.title: Registration Now Open for NSF GRFP Bootcamp
item.description: Date: Wednesday, June 5, 2024 8:00 AM - First-year graduate students, juniors and seniors are encouraged to register for this virtual program to develop strong applications to the National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship Program, which begins June 24 and provides three years of salary and tuition while students earn their graduate degree. U.S. citizenship or permanent residency is required.

item.title: HelioCampus Training, Resources to Aid Instructors in Reviewing Spring Course Results
item.description:
Spring 2024 student course evaluation results will be available to instructors on May 28, 2024; on May 30 and June 10, the Office of Undergraduate Education will offer live webinar training for instructors and TAs on running those results. Those who cannot attend a live session or prefer to review on their own may refer to the HelioCampus Resource Site.
